notes: Most widely used OTC analgesic in Nigeria

major_contraindications: Respiratory depression,Acute intoxication with alcohol/drugs,MAO inhibitor use
black_box_warning_text: Respiratory depression, addiction risk, seizure risk at high doses
major_drug_interactions: CNS depressants (enhanced sedation),MAOIs (serotonin syndrome),SSRIs (serotonin syndrome),Alcohol (respiratory depression)
notes: NAFDAC controlled since 2018 due to abuse. Requires special prescription.

black_box_warning_text: Respiratory depression in children, risk of addiction, ultra-rapid metabolizers at risk
major_drug_interactions: CNS depressants (respiratory depression),MAOIs (severe reactions),Alcohol (enhanced sedation),Benzodiazepines (respiratory depression)
notes: High abuse potential. Restricted use in children.

major_contraindications: Acute narrow-angle glaucoma,Severe respiratory insufficiency,Myasthenia gravis
black_box_warning_text: Dependence and withdrawal syndrome, respiratory depression, impaired cognition
major_drug_interactions: CNS depressants (enhanced sedation),Opioids (respiratory depression),Alcohol (severe CNS depression),Phenytoin (altered levels)
notes: Long-term use risk of dependence. Taper slowly to discontinue.

black_box_warning_text: Bleeding risk, requires regular INR monitoring, narrow therapeutic window
major_drug_interactions: NSAIDs (bleeding risk),Aspirin (bleeding risk),Antibiotics (altered INR),Cranberry juice (increased effect),Vitamin K (decreased effect)
food_interactions: Avoid cranberry, limit vitamin K foods, avoid alcohol
notes: Requires regular INR monitoring. Many drug and food interactions.

mechanism_of_action: Lowers blood glucose by facilitating cellular glucose uptake
major_drug_interactions: Other insulins (dosing adjustments),Beta-blockers (mask hypoglycemia),ACE inhibitors (increased hypoglycemia risk)
notes: Refrigerate unopened vials. Room temp once opened. Critical medication.

major_contraindications: Severe renal impairment (eGFR <30),Metabolic acidosis,Acute heart failure
food_interactions: Take with food, avoid excessive alcohol
notes: First-line for type 2 diabetes. Check renal function regularly.

safer_alternatives: Cephalosporins (if mild penicillin allergy),Azithromycin (if penicillin allergic)
notes: Complete full course even if symptoms improve. Common first-line antibiotic.

major_contraindications: Active GI bleeding,Severe heart failure,Third trimester pregnancy
major_drug_interactions: Warfarin (bleeding risk),Aspirin (reduced cardioprotective effect),ACE inhibitors (reduced antihypertensive effect),Lithium (increased toxicity)
food_interactions: Take with food to reduce GI upset
safer_alternatives: Paracetamol (less GI risk),Topical NSAIDs (for localized pain)
notes: Take with food. Avoid in cardiovascular disease. Short-term use preferred.

major_contraindications: Respiratory depression,Acute asthma,Paralytic ileus,Raised intracranial pressure
black_box_warning_text: Severe respiratory depression risk, high addiction potential, tolerance develops rapidly
major_drug_interactions: CNS depressants (severe respiratory depression),MAOIs (severe reactions),Benzodiazepines (respiratory depression),Alcohol (fatal respiratory depression)
notes: Highly controlled. Reserved for severe pain. High abuse potential.
